ParentConstraint Class Reference

Constraint from which other constraints can be inherited. Extends dynamicconstraint to allow children to be dynamic. More...

Detailed Description

Constraint from which other constraints can be inherited. Extends dynamicconstraint to allow children to be dynamic.

Definition at line 229 of file constraint_abstract.h.

Member Function Documentation

virtual triggerCollection ParentConstraint::setup_internal_gather_triggers (  )  [inline, virtual]

Gets all the triggers a constraint wants to set up.

This function shouldn't do any propagation. That is full_propagate's job.

Reimplemented from AbstractConstraint.

virtual int ParentConstraint::dynamic_trigger_count_with_children (  )  [inline, virtual]

Returns the number of dynamic triggers for this constraint, and all the children of this constraint. Only differs from the above for things like 'reify', 'reifyimply' and 'or'.

Reimplemented from AbstractConstraint.

virtual void ParentConstraint::setup (  )  [inline, virtual]

Actually creates the dynamic triggers. Calls dynamic_trigger_count from function to get the number of triggers required.
